net.dean.jraw.http.oauth

Interface OAuthSpec

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardOAuthorizationFlow

    public interface OAuthSpec

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(java.lang.String clientId, java.lang.String redirectUri, boolean permanent, java.lang.String scope, java.lang.String... otherScopes)
      Gets the URL used to authorize a user using OAuth2 'installed' or 'web' type app.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(java.lang.String clientId,
                                   java.lang.String redirectUri,
                                   boolean permanent,
                                   java.lang.String scope,
                                   java.lang.String... otherScopes)
        Gets the URL used to authorize a user using OAuth2 'installed' or 'web' type app.
        Parameters:
        clientId - The app's client ID
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        permanent - Whether or not the token can be used more than one time
        Returns:
        The URL clients are sent to in order to authorize themselves

      • onAuthorize

        AuthData onAuthorize(java.lang.String finalUrl,
                   java.lang.String redirectUri,
                   Credentials creds)
                     throws NetworkException,
                            OAuthException,
                            java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            java.net.MalformedURLException
        Parses the query arguments passed to this URI. If no error is present and the 'state' code matches the one most recently generated, then an access token is requested.
        Parameters:
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        finalUrl - The URL that the HTTP client redirected to after the user chose either to authorize or not authorize the application. This will be the app's redirect URI with the addition of a few query parameters.
        creds - The credentials to retrieve the access token with. Only the client ID and client secret will be used.
        Throws:
        OAuthException - If there was a problem with any of the parameters given
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If finalUrl is not a valid URL
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the state last generated with getAuthorizationUrl(String, String, boolean, String, String...) did not match the value of the 'state' query parameter.
